issue.title: [Python] Improve performance of serializing sets
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-1480](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1480). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
See this:

https://github.com/ray-project/ray/issues/938

There is a PR here which I'll submit:

https://github.com/apache/arrow/compare/master...pcmoritz:serialize-sets

Let me know what you think! Supporting sets natively is good I think, we may also want to good way to support efficient serialization of more general iterables without converting them to a list.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1480?focusedCommentId=16156189) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Sounds good to me. I can review further in the PR!

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1480?focusedCommentId=16159460) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Issue resolved by pull request 1060
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/1060>
